Author: jl777c#5810
Content: exchanges tend to not run the --exchange, and if they do it will create fat blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the big reduction is due to the changing to monthly rewards cap from annual

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: you can't really force anyone to run anything other than default

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: txfee is the sum of inputs - sum of outputs. rewards makes the inputs become larger, that is why you see negative txfee for rewards claims more than 0.0001

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but exchanges like the rewards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since they dont have to stake or anything, it is very convenient for them. it even works for cold addresses

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: removing the unclaimed rewards is thus technically tricky and would change the equilibrium across the entire ecosystem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: --exchange flag was made for exchanges that have to financially account for every satoshi

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and all these rewards satoshis totally broke their accounting software

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it just doesnt add the rewards value to the sum of inputs, meaning all tx will have unclaimed rewards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if only all users claimed rewards, there wouldnt be any problem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: hostages?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: how will you force the exchanges to run that mode?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: binance is now distributing rewards to users, so they would need to collect the rewards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe all exchanges should do that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: can we revist this after we get 2 or 3 months of data on the actual level of unclaimed rewards?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: thanks. without knowing this, there is no way to know the appropriate level of effort or urgency for this

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: Please, give this topic a break

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: It has been like this for 2 months and there has been no issues so far

Author: Alright#0419
Content: `-donation=<pubkey>` is probably optimal for CEXs

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it "donates" all the rewards to the specified pubkey

Author: Alright#0419
Content: won't mess with their dbs and still claims rewards

Content: @dan. it gives NN ops a place to talk about potential active attacks, and also critical bugfixes with security implications. Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: i dont understand what the big governance issue is here.  jl777 wanted to change things so that NNs get 75% of rewards, closing the underminign loophole, and you didnt like the way he proposed to change it?

Content: (was in response to one of dwy's comments)

Content: My suggestion was to burn all large reward  blocks, but nobody liked that. :abusedsmily:

Content: burn the large blocks! 😄

Content: yes, nobody could agree... so just delete it and nobody gets it

Content: exactly

Content: hurts miners rewards hodlers

Content: i understand why no miners or NNs wanted that

Content: yes

Content: ah

Author: Alexfrog#1338

Content: if you send a tx that could have claimed 10 KMD in rewards but didn't, the miner can claim that 10 KMD

Content: i didnt realize any miners or NNs got them

Content: sometimes they are stupidly large, most assume it's from CEXs

Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: it makes more sense now

Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: honestly those should be burnt, or not able to be claimed

Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: but i understand why miners/NNs want them and are fighting over them
